sub_title: Programme Manager Burkina Faso and Senegal at Aqua for All
summary:
An energetic and result-oriented young professional with a global mindset and a passion for driving impact, sustainable development and (social) innovation. With a background and expertise in private sector development, international development, and catalytic and innovative finance for early-stage and growth enterprises in emerging and fragile markets.

Perceived as a proactive and fully-committed person with strong social and communication skills that enable me to easily build and manage relationships with a wide variety of stakeholders. 

Embracing every challenge with a can-do attitude by having a pragmatic and flexible mentality, while being highly structured and organised. Determined to be part of the solution to today's sustainability challenges facing our business and society.

Currently contributing towards this in my role at Aqua for All, coordinating Aqua for All's country programmes by supporting water and sanitation (WASH) market development, deploying Technical Assistance and seed capital to stimulate innovation and acceleration SME growth in West Africa.

projects:
[{'title': 'New Business Challenge Ghana 2019', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Exchange program commissioned by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs in which 20 Ghanaian and 20 Dutch students and young professionals jointly work on business cases. The program includes workshops and trainings, two weeks of fieldwork in The Netherlands and two weeks of fieldwork in Ghana. 

The business case I worked on was for Tempohousing, a company that aims to resolve the enormous housing problems in Ghana through implementing its concept of modular, low cost, self-contained and sustainable housing. The question given to our team by Tempohousing was: “How can we make the container housing more affordable for low-income households?" Our solution focussed on creating a blended finance fund in combination with an online financial product (susu model) for the target market. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rachel', 'last_name': 'van der Pol', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programme Manager Burkina Faso and Senegal at Aqua for All'}]}, {'title': 'Climbing Mt. Kilimanjaro to raise money to support African eco-friendly entrepreneurs through Kiva', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'During my internship at Kenya Climate Innovation Center I have learned and experienced more than ever that dreams and ambitions are universal, but opportunities are not. With my passion for sustainability and hiking, I took the opportunity to give back to the Kenyan society and make an impact. Therefore I challenged myself to combine and accomplish two of my personal ambitions: climb Mt. Kilimanjaro and thereby make a contribution to achieving the SDGs. By climbing Mt. Kilimanjaro (with 5.895 metres African’s highest mountain), I raised €1.500 that provides Kenyan entrepreneurs with an opportunity to chase their dreams and start their eco-friendly businesses. 

Instead of collecting money to donate to charity, I chose to work with the organisation Kiva (www.kiva.org). Kiva is an international non-profit micro-financing organisation that fights poverty by connecting people with loans. By offering a micro-loan to disadvantaged people, these entrepreneurs get a chance to set up or improve their businesses. Moreover, the raised money will be reinvested on a continuous basis through giving loans.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rachel', 'last_name': 'van der Pol', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programme Manager Burkina Faso and Senegal at Aqua for All'}]}, {'title': 'Graduation Research Project on Patient Experience at Bernhoven Hospital', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'As a research student for Hospitality@Work, a research unit at the NHTV, I conducted research in order to improve the guest experience in Bernhoven Hospital. The project was focussed on designing a human-centered experience by distinguishing different guests and their context, needs and wishes. This resulted in an advisory report on the guestjourney and the development of a measurement tool that assists the hospital in measuring and evaluating the current experience at two pilot departments.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Rachel', 'last_name': 'van der Pol', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Programme Manager Burkina Faso and Senegal at Aqua for All'}]}]

​We strive to create an innovative, sustainable and inclusive water and sanitation economy worldwide.  

Innovations, scalable solutions and capital are instrumental to bridge the current service delivery and financial gap in the water and sanitation economy. Aqua for All bridges these gaps by supporting innovations and enabling business solutions to become viable. We realise this by mobilising public and private capital.
